summary: Email chain between legal staff discussing updates to the victim notification system (VNS) for the US v. Epstein case. The correspondence focuses on verifying and correcting victim names, adding new victims, obtaining contact information, and coordinating with case agents and attorneys for notification purposes.

persons.name: Fro
persons.context: Mentioned as the attorney representing a victim who should be added to the victim list.

persons.name: Boies Schiller
persons.context: Referenced in relation to an attorney who represents several victims, with a note that the contact info is misspelled.

connections.description: Fro is identified as the attorney representing a victim who needs to be added to the victim list.

events.title: Email regarding victim list corrections
events.description: An email was sent requesting corrections to the VNS system, including fixing typos in victim names, updating attorney information, and adding new victims.

events.title: Forwarded email chain on victim list
events.description: Email chain forwarded discussing the updated victim list for US v. Epstein, coordination with AUSAs and case agents to obtain contact information for victims, and preparation for victim notifications.

keyFacts: The document is part of an email chain from July 2019 regarding the victim notification system (VNS) for the US v. Epstein case.
Legal staff are working to update and correct a victim list, including adding new victims and fixing errors in names and attorney information.
There is a need to obtain contact information for several victims, with coordination suggested between AUSAs and FBI case agents.
An attorney named 'Fro' is identified as representing a victim who should be added to the list, and the law firm Boies Schiller is mentioned in relation to attorney contact information.
The correspondence highlights the volume of victims and the systematic effort to ensure accurate notifications are sent.
